South African entrepreneur, philanthropist and founder of the NGO "I Make A Dream" shares the story of her journey from being an orphan to creating a charity project that helps people fulfill their dreams.
Make the decision- The realization of your dreams requires you to come up with a plan to achieve them. Without a clear goal, it will be difficult to stay motivated and on-track.
Ask for help- Don't be afraid to ask for help if you need it along the way. Reach out to those who have succeeded in their dreams and use their experience as a guide to help you stay on-track.
Do your research- Before embarking on a journey to make your dreams come true, it's important to identify where you need more skills. Invest time learning new skills, either by taking classes or reading books, to make sure you have the knowledge you require to succeed.
Set goals and deadlines- To make the most of your dreams, you need to set clear, specific goals. Write down your goals, then break them down into smaller tasks and set deadlines so you can stay on track.
Make a timeline- Once you've made a goal, the next step is to create a timeline of activities that will help you reach your goal. Include milestones along the way to demonstrate your progress and stay motivated.
Monitor and evaluate your progress- Once you've set your dreams, it's important to regularly check in with them and evaluate your progress. Taking the time to monitor your progress will help you identify the challenges you're facing and help you make adjustments.
Make the most out of your dreams- The road to reaching any goal is never easy, and inevitably life gets in the way and throws you off course. But with these tips, you can stick to your dreams despite obstacles and make them come true.
Make it fun- Make sure you're having fun while working towards your dreams, even the smallest steps. It's okay to make mistakes and to adjust your plans. Making your dreams fun will keep you motivated and will make it easier to face the inevitable challenges of any journey.
Stay focused- Staying focused on your dreams is key. It's easy to get distracted and forget about the bigger picture. Make sure to take a step back and stay focused on what you want to achieve in order to make your dreams a reality.
Accept the help of others- At the end of the day, no one can do everything themselves. It's ok to ask for help from others in order to make your dreams a reality. Don't forget to thank the people who have been there for you along the way.
Believe in yourself- Finally, never forget to believe in yourself. No matter how bad the situation, don’t lose focus. Keep believing in yourself and your path to achieve your dreams.

The Zombification and Resignation Processes
By SJ on May 14, 2009 5:06 PM | 7 Comments
You know, these are my finals and I'm running late and not doing any work today; it can be done!
I had already done a lot of work on this topic today, so I thought I'd share a couple of my findings.
First, I have decided that I like the 'resignation' to the inevitability of death the best. It's easier. It's a quicker acceptance of death than Zombiaction is, and to be honest, I like the 'I can do nothing to stop things from going wrong' line of thinking.
Second, I did some reading on the zombification process. I came across this blog post, which seemed to have all the makings of a decent zombification plan.
Step 1: Cut your Achilles tendon.
Step 2: Walk the rest of the way, still bleeding.
Step 3: Wait around, bleeding, until you die.
Step 4: Rise again to eat the flesh of the living!
It's not so effective, but it's certainly a start.
A zombie could be a person in a state of extreme mental confusion. This state of mind might be brought about by such things as drugs, alcohol, extreme stress, or other unforeseen circumstances. Because zombies are often in a stupor, they might have difficulty maintaining any form of organization, thus rendering them impossible as workers. A zombie is more likely to try and harm a person than help them. They do not know how to talk and cannot understand speech. They cannot read or write, which presents a problem in the teaching and learning system in Singapore. They cannot distinguish between right and wrong and therefore cannot follow any moral codes, which means that we will have to monitor them closely so that they do not kill anyone. This might be a cause of some inconvenience.
A zombie’s ability is also severely lacking. They have slow movements and they take awhile to learn new things. Their brains cannot handle any sort of complex reasoning and thinking. This means that they cannot remember the date on their own. If I tell you “My birthday is in 2012” you might be able to remember it better than a zombie. Also, their vision is affected. Their colour-vision will be impaired and they will see shadows and flashes of light.
However, these are just a few of the disadvantages of zombies. Perhaps I have yet to come across the most important point: that zombies cannot die.
Therefore, unlike humans, a zombie can keep on living for thousands of years. It makes the risk of death-inducing sicknesses, diseases and accidents more bearable. The zombies don’t even need food, for they can get nutrition from whatever they can find! They can survive off fumes of smoke and human flesh.
The government has recently stated that they want to open zombie laboratories. These zombies can be our future workers, but the people are so scared that most of them refuse to be enlisted. They think that the zombies have all sorts of diseases and they could die.
I have decided on being an expert in all fields of Singaporean zombies and their diseases, so that I can give advice to zombies on how to maintain an extraordinarily good health and to humans, on how to recognize zombies. This will be my last year. Next year, I will be studying medicine and specialising in zombie cures.
How To Avoid A Zombie Apocalypse
By WJ on May 14, 2009 11:13 AM | 1 Comment
It is possible to be prepared for a Zombie Apocalypse. You must have a certain list of supplies to be able to survive a Zombie Apocalypse. All these supplies, of course, must be obtained by you before the advent of the Zombie Apocalypse, otherwise it is pointless to obtain them afterwards. These supplies are categorized as follows:
This includes items such as:
Food (Meat, milk, vegetables, etc.)
Weapons (Guns, machetes, and a bok choy for stabbing)
A Zombie buster (Gives you the ability to take out zombies with super ease, but if you lose the buster, it is very hard to get another.)
Clothing (It always rains during a zombie apocalypse. Get prepared.)
This includes water, food, and other necessities. Your body requires a certain amount of sustenance in order to function and thus cannot tolerate long periods of hunger.
Weapons and Zombie busters, need I explain?
As I have mentioned before, my life is complete without meat, but you might not have the same mentality. I would suggest preparing a lot of food and packing it away, as that is the best supply of food you can obtain. You can also get the vegetables from the free vegetable section at 7.30 or 8.30am, as the food there has just been discarded. That's quite a steal, if I may say so. Another source is obviously food courts and supermarkets.
To get water, you should either visit the river, or even better, boil water that you get from the tap. Do note, however, that the water should be treated to not get you sick. Do not drink tap water without boiling it, or using bleach if you need to.
And that sums it up. Be prepared, my fellow Zombie Killers!
